column4: i have ubuntu xp and vista in a triple boot, i wanna remove vista, how do i go about that without messing things up?
you can just destroy the whole partition and delete the entry from menu.lst
type `blkid` into the terminal, and whichever partition is NTFS would be vista
it should tell you which partition belongs to Vista
then you can go on to delete that partition
it shows a list with like /dev/blah UUID=asdkfa;lebaofibaoe right?
okay.. now you know /dev/sda5 belongs to vista, all you have to do is delete that partition
i don't know if this'll work, but you can try `dd if=/dev/null of=/dev/sda5
nope.. you have to edit your menu.lst file to remove it from the boot menu
`sudo gedit /boot/grub/menu.lst` then scroll down to the windows entry and delete it
you can delete it.... title VISta blah blah chainloader +1 and all that stuff right?

yup, delete that... but what bothers me is that your menu.lst has the wrong partition .. it says /dev/sda1 while your blkid output says that Vista is on /dev/sda5... and it'd be horrible if i made you delete the wrong partition
really? then there's no point in deleting the entry from menu.lst
yup all you're doing is deleting the vista entry from your menu.lst, XP uses a different bootloader i believe.
but deleting your vista partition could still be a good idea if you want more harddrive space..
